claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.
explanation: A flowchart depicting the selection and exclusion of 2,776,278 vaccinated adults aged 18–64 over three influenza seasons (2018–2021), showing numbers who received recombinant vaccine versus standard-dose vaccine, sequential exclusion for non-KPNC membership, inpatient vaccinations, out-of-range vaccine dates, missing facility identifiers, inability to assign facility-specific propensity scores, and final cohort counts by age group. The figure presents participant flow and cohort selection criteria for recombinant versus standard-dose vaccines and does not present any data or statements regarding mutations arising during cell- or egg-based vaccine production or their impact on vaccine effectiveness, and therefore does not support the claim.
